title: Complex Temporal Cognition (CTC) Schema
description: Machine-readable specification of Complex Temporal Cognition as the temporal substrate of HCIP.

temporalLayers.description: Multi-layer temporal representation used by CTC.

symbolicTime.description: Encoded temporal relations within symbolic structures.

temporalOperators.description: Core temporal operations defined by CTC.

feedForward.description: Whether the system supports projection of current states into future expectations.

retroactiveReinterpretation.description: Whether the system supports reinterpretation of past states based on new information.

temporalShear.description: Whether divergence between physical and cognitive time is permitted.

recursiveLoops.description: Whether recursive temporal updates are allowed.

epochalSegmentation.description: Whether experience can be partitioned into discrete interpretive epochs.

temporalDrift.description: Parameters governing drift within the temporal substrate.

driftVector.description: Vector representing drift magnitude across temporal layers.

epsilonBound.description: Maximum allowable drift magnitude to maintain architectural stability.

stateTransitionModel.description: Formal operators governing transitions between temporal states.

T_operator.description: Definition of the forward temporal operator T: S(t) → S(t+1).

R_operator.description: Definition of the retroactive reinterpretation operator R: S(t+1) → S(t).

supports3AC.description: Whether the system maintains stability under the 3AC operator.

boundaryClauses.description: Boundary conditions ensuring consistency of CTC within HCIP.

temporalPrimacy.description: Symbolic and interpretive operations must respect temporal primitives.

nonReversibility.description: Past states cannot be overwritten; only interpretations may change.

driftContainment.description: Drift must remain within epsilon bounds.

symbolicCompliance.description: Symbolic operators cannot violate temporal constraints.

interpretiveCoherence.description: Interpretive constructs must remain coherent under recursive updates.
